message: So we've been accepted to the challenge. If anyone is interested in being on the team we have 3 spots left.  Please let me know soon.
When does work begin on the project?
We've begun planning.  We're in week 2 now.  I need to make a blogpost of the progress which has just been planning.  We need to buy supplies soon.
What work has been done & how can it be seen/contributed to?

I've started sourcing parts for the device.  We're going to need a screen, amarine battery, a high torque 12volt motor that can be speed controlled.  A generator that can be hooked up to a bike and charge a 12volt battery. Some wood that can be laser cut and some plexiglass.  Also possibly some linear bearings.
also, I suggest a meter on the marine battery to show it's charge live, perhaps plot the charging cycles online (if it is dramatic enough), http://iobridge.com pr http://pachube.com style.
I noticed, in Mitch Altman's description, that he was looking for ways to "teach kids." Is our project's target kids?
So that will be for all ages.  I want to hook the uzebox (from redbull) up to it and have maybe a holographic learning game.  Or just simply a globe you can spin around.
It's going to be the 3DPOV I want to make sure we license it correctly.
ideally it should be as square as possible... so as to create a nice 3d field.
Any suggestions on which marine battery to get?
And it will be recharged by a bicycle generator
Jay K may have some good recommendations for batteries, being a sailor and all.
